Line 27: Line 27:
==Death==
==Death==
  +
[[File:Ali Jawad al-Sheikh dead.jpg|thumb|A picture of Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's corpse.]]
A number of witnesses, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, were present at the protest in the town of [[Sitra]], which had been organized with a small group of people for just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, who fired tear gas at them from roughly 20 feet away." In an interview with the [[Associated Press]], Isa explained, "They are supposed to lob the canisters of gas, not shoot them at people. Police used it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
A number of witnesses, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, were present at the protest in the town of [[Sitra]], which had been organized with a small group of people for just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, who fired tear gas at them from roughly 20 feet away." In an interview with the [[Associated Press]], Isa explained, "They are supposed to lob the canisters of gas, not shoot them at people. Police used it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
